headline: Booking’s (BKNG) Long-Term Growth Outlook Drives Upgrade from Morgan Stanley
summary: Booking Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ:BKNG) is included among the 13 Most Promising Long-Term Stocks to Buy According to Hedge Funds. headline: KAYAK reveals the UK’s top breaks for Slow Travel with a dog
summary: LONDON, Feb. 25, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- As slower-paced holidays continue to grow in popularity, more British travelling dog owners are choosing staycations that prioritise relaxation and healthier daily routines for both, pet and passenger. From coastal walks and countryside trails to unhurried afternoons in dog-friendly pubs, KAYAK, a leading travel search engine, reveals the UK’s top getaways for travellers looking to unwind with their four-legged companion. headline: The 5 Most Interesting Analyst Questions From Booking’s Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Booking’s fourth quarter drew a negative market reaction, despite revenue and non-GAAP profit meeting or exceeding Wall Street expectations. headline: Should Booking’s Stock Split, Dividend and New Revenue Streams Reframe How BKNG Investors View Its Cash Engine?
summary: Booking Holdings recently reported past fourth-quarter 2025 revenue of US$6,349 million and net income of US$1,428 million, alongside a 25-for-1 stock split effective April 2, 2026, and a quarterly dividend of US$10.50 per share payable March 31, 2026. At the same time, Booking is pushing into new areas such as OpenTable Media advertising, Agoda’s AI-enhanced support, and the Rocket Travel–China Airlines StayMiles partnership, underlining how its travel platforms are being monetized beyond...

headline: Restaurant reservation wars heat up as DoorDash enters the arena with Resy, OpenTable
summary: The still-simmering reservation wars of the last decade could fully reignite this year, as a shifting tech landscape pits the biggest players against each other.

raw.headline: Restaurant reservation wars heat up as DoorDash enters the arena with Resy, OpenTable
raw.summary: The still-simmering reservation wars of the last decade could fully reignite this year, as a shifting tech landscape pits the biggest players against each other.

headline: Why OpenTable, Resy and DoorDash are fighting for your reservation
summary: Founded in 1998, OpenTable went relatively unchallenged in the online reservation space for more than a decade. Its dominance was disrupted by Resy, which targeted highly sought-after restaurants by undercutting OpenTable on pricing and offering more advanced software. OpenTable has since revamped its business model and partnered with Visa and Chase to better compete with American Express-backed Resy and new entrants like DoorDash.

raw.headline: Why OpenTable, Resy and DoorDash are fighting for your reservation

headline: Agoda Reveals Top 10 Warm-Weather Winter Escapes for Taiwanese Travelers, with Okinawa Leading the List
summary: As cold fronts roll in one after another, Taiwanese travelers' getaway plans are shifting south in search of sunshine. Digital travel platform Agoda observed accommodation search trends for early-year trips (Jan–Feb) and found that warm-weather escapes have become the go-to travel mindset. From islands and vibrant cities to easy short breaks, travelers are favoring destinations that are warm, packed with good food and great shopping, and easy to reach, turning winter into a quick dose of summer.
